website_summaries.verdict: Perfect climbing shoe for those on a budget who spend time climbing indoors or outdoors.
pros: Versatile men's climbing shoe, as it works equally well for those using the climbing wall indoors or on a mountain outdoors
Sturdy rubber heel and soles will ensure a high level of performance
Even with a low price point, this climbing shoe has a nice level of comfort
cons: Lace eyelets may give out over time when placed under constant stress

customer_reviews.title: Show wore off only after 2 months of use!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the shoes for the last 2 months ago, my routine is 3 times a week bouldering sessions. After that short amount of time, I suddenly find that the front of the show just wore out and created a hole. This hole developed to a bigger hole and now I cannot use them because they lost gripping strength when I toe hook or even smear. I expected a lot more for the money for the shoe cost. This is really REALLY disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size 12 in women's. I bought the 42.5 and it has worked great. I originally wanted to go with the 43 because it was comfortable enough to wear when walking for more than 5min. I decided to size down to 42.5 because i heard these stretch. I'm glad I did as I think the fit is just right (very snug but not painful). These aren't hardcore by any means, but for a beginner I really like them. I I switched out the laces for "Quick Lock" stretch laces. This makes slipping off the back heal of the shoe between climbs way easier and faster.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Order the size you wear
customer_reviews.text: Some people were saying to order 3 sizes smaller than you wear, so I did. Got a 39 instead of a 42. It's a 6.5 equivalent when I normally wear a 10.5 needless to say they are much too small. I will be returning and ordering a larger size
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Fits great, climbs even better
customer_reviews.text: I am always so nervous about buying shoes online since the size varies from different brands. I would recommend going to a local store that sells climbing shoes and just try some on until you find a good fit, you can usually find climbing shoes a lot cheaper online. I've been using these shoes both for indoor and outdoor climbing since March 2015 and they still look and feel pretty good. I've been climbing for a year now and I would recommend these shoes for any beginner. I usually wear size 12 mens and got these in size 47.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe. Get them snug fitting though!
customer_reviews.text: Fits closer to a street shoe size, so I ended up needing to go down a size from what I usually get. Normally I buy 9 1/2 in climbing shoes but in these a 9 seems to fit a little better. Take into account a good shoe should not be painful, but your toes shoes be pressed against the end of the shoe. This is especially important because leather shoes like these stretch (about a half size) and if they become too big you won’t be able to keep your toes on small ledges.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Kay Slater

customer_reviews.title: Size 10 US, got 42.5 UK
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous because I'm from the US and not used to ordering UK sizing. I looked up a conversion chart and it said size 10 is about a 43... so I opted for a 42.5 for this purchase, since I wanted a really snug fit for climbing. Then I went in and climbed with a size 10 shoe at my local gym, which started to hurt after a while... I looked and it was a 43. Fortunately this shoe came in, and I guess they run a bit larger than the manufacturer of the gyms shoes... because these fit perfect (might even be a smidge too long). But I'm totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I use the shoe to climb indoors. I would say it is a moderate shoe for indoor climbing. I wouldn't attempt an outdoor climb with this shoe. Also, make sure you are vigilant whether this is a men's or women's shoe. I ordered the shoe and it was a male shoe. I needed a female shoe. That mistake, more than likely, was my fault. )-:
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, but little pricey.
customer_reviews.text: Fits as expected. Good overall shoe and quality. The rubber is sticky as all fit out. Buuuut overall after using some shoes with a more aggressive angle I probably won’t be wearing these again. Great shoe if you want some comfortable entry level shoes, but a little expensive for that, and not something I would use on difficult routes with small foot holds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the fit
customer_reviews.text: YAHTZEE! After trying several pairs of climbing shoes, and constantly hating the fit, I gave these a go and I love them. They are snug, but very comfortable. I am thinking about snagging a second pair now. For the record I am a size 10.5 - 11 US, and I went with the 43.5.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Kramer

customer_reviews.title: US 12 normal shoes, size 47 tarantulace worked for me
customer_reviews.text: I wear men US size 12 running shoe. I bought a size 47m in the men tarantulace. They fit snug but not too tight. My upper heal gets a little wear right around the back of the heel near the ankle. I have not broken them in yet but I feel like a size smaller woukd be too small. I also don’t like my climbing shoes super tight like some people prefer. The toe on the tarantulace is less stiff than my madrock drifter shoes. So it puts a slight bit more pressure on the toes where the drivers spread it over the front of the foot a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Grimes

customer_reviews.title: Good first pair
customer_reviews.text: Well if your looking to stick to the side of the sears tower as you scale up it looking for evil villains these aren’t the shoe for you. With that said if it’s your first pair and you want to be able to kick the wall a time or two or abuse them like mistress abuses me then they are what your looking for. Mine have come to calling me master and beg for more I’ll intented technique and improper use but they are a work horse and just keep on keeping on.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner shoes
customer_reviews.text: I began bouldering in early March and fell in love with it. I knew right away I needed a pair of climbing shoes and these were recommended as good entry level shoes. They work great, but the break in period was painful and took a few sessions to get them fully acclimated to my feet but they've been a pleasure to climb in ever since. I wear a 10.5 naturally and decided to go with a 10 in these as people suggest getting a size or so smaller than your normal size. I only wish I got the velcro version, but nonetheless a great purchase and I recommend these shoes if you are starting out.
customer_reviews.author: Justin H

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre and annoyingly bad grip
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is hard to size. I had to order 6 pairs. After having climbed in the shoes for a few weeks I'm finding the grip lacking. Especially compared to my black diamond shoes. In fact I just fell due to poor grip. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe. Will recommend for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for indoor bouldering. I am a size 10.5 us men and ordered a size 10. It was a little tight for the first couple sessions but streched out to a comfortable fit within a week. I might have gotten away with getting a full size down but I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Magnus Verdegrand

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and grip, but...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoes. I absolutely loved climbing with my pair while they were still usable. Maybe I just received a defective pair, but unfortunately one of the lace "eyeholes" got torn out after two months of casual use. I would buy from La Sportiva again, but I'll try velcro next time.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Fenton

customer_reviews.title: Best climbing shoe fit I have experienced.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit for climbing shoes. Toe box is tight like it is supposed to be, but without being painful like climbing shoes I have previously worn. I went a half size bigger than my normal shoe size and they fit fine. Great shoe to use in climbing gyms.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan E Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great for indoor and outdoor climbing for intermediate
customer_reviews.text: We climb indoors at a gym, but recently also climbed outside in CO on beginner and intermediate routes. These shoes worked great for our 11 yr old son. They should fit tight and they were great for him. He wears a 7 1/2 Men's usually. My son's only complaint is they tie and don't have Velcro, but he only complained about it once.
customer_reviews.author: Hinkerdink

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: Check sizing and do research to determine size appropriate for your foot. I wear a 12, and bought the size 11 and it is perfect. I have rigid flat feet, and they are still comfortable. Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.author: Jay Martin

customer_reviews.title: The Challenges of Sizing
customer_reviews.text: Good all-around climbing shoe and the price is right - a bit large so you may want to go a size down. Since it's European measurements, it makes things a little difficult. May be smart to include both euro and american measurements in the ad - I had to go to a different website to make sure I chose the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Sizes a little small
customer_reviews.text: I stretched them with shoe stretchers and still a little tight. Found they pinch cross the top of your toes when under tension. I think the upper toe cap is too stiff. My mythos are like 10 times better than these but also double the price.
customer_reviews.author: Voracious_Reader

customer_reviews.title: Love, but Try On In Store
customer_reviews.text: This fit as expected....for a climbing shoe. I bought these as a replacement for a pair I bought in person at a store. I knew they fit me well as climbing shoes are supposed to be very form fitting. I will repurchase when these go, but highly recommend you try your first pair on in person! I am a recreational climber - typically around 5.9s.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer mcDonald

customer_reviews.title: All around a good purchase for beginner that wants a comfortable shoe that ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this and the size was a bit too big, but I also have very wide feet so climbing shoes are difficult. The lace guides are starting to ware off after 6 months. All around a good purchase for beginner that wants a comfortable shoe that is a level above what you get at a bouldering gym.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: I ordered according to the size chart from La Sportiva, and the fit is great. Not so tight that it hurts my feet, but tight enough that my feet don't have wiggle room. I also have fairly wide feet, so I was worried they would be too narrow, but they were fine. I'm starting to see some wear on on the front of the shoe after maybe 10 climbing sessions, so I'm just hoping that they will last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Sower

customer_reviews.title: Shoe size - tighter than expect
customer_reviews.text: New to climbing and these were recommended. A lot of people were stating that you should get a half size to a whole size down from your normal shoe size. I wear 11 US and purchased a 10.5 in these shoes and was surprised to find they were much tighter than expected, my toes were crunching up. I’ve since worn them several times and they have stretched slightly, but are still uncomfortably tight. Other than the size, they have been great shoes with a price that won’t break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: dfehnel

customer_reviews.title: good value, sizes are true, good toe edges and laces
customer_reviews.text: the size stays true and does not give too much in the toes. hugs the toes just enough for good control against the walls. laces are tough and have never come loose in about 3 months of weekly use. i got the orange ones and after 2 hours of climbing my feet are usually stained orange but washes off easily. shoes are comfortable and the edges are fairly tough havent seen any wear on them yet but i use them for indoor gyms only. Probably the best shoe for the money on amazon
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: My go-to climbing shoes
customer_reviews.text: I advise going up half a size, but other than that, these are great climbing shoes. I’ve had a pair for six months and just ordered another. Great product at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Sputnik

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: I use a US 9 for my everyday shoes, I bough these in 41.5M EU, they fit great
customer_reviews.author: Arturo

customer_reviews.title: These shoes feel less bulky and are more comfortable than the typical rental shoe at a rock gym
customer_reviews.text: I have a narrow foot and these fit expected. The craftsmanship and materials are worth the investment for a beginner at indoor or outdoor rock climbing. These shoes feel less bulky and are more comfortable than the typical rental shoe at a rock gym, especially if you need a narrower shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan P. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes! Comfortable for me to wear. My normal shoe size is 14 and these are comfortable for me to wear continuously for over an hour.
customer_reviews.author: AlJonesDino5

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME SHOES.
customer_reviews.text: SHOES ARE VERY WELL MADE AND DESIGNED. THEY ARE DESIGNED TO TACKLE ON THE HARD CLIMBS BUT MADE TO STILL BE PRETTY COMFORTABLE. ONLY ISSUE IS IT TOOK PRETTY LONG TO GET THE ITEM.
customer_reviews.author: DOBY DADDY

customer_reviews.title: I'm no rock climbing expert but they worked good for me
customer_reviews.text: have used them indoor and outdoor. They're tight, but supposed to be. they don't cut off my circulation or cause pain. normally wear a 13 wide. Hope to get to use them more.
customer_reviews.author: CCATT1Manz

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great comfortable beginner shoe. People always say get strapped shoes but these laces work just fine, they're not aggressive and i can comfortable wear them during a whole sesh. I do recommend going to a local store such as REI to fit test these before getting them online. Im originally a 8.5 M but I downsized to 7.5 M and it fit perfectly (a little tight at first but it stretches).
customer_reviews.author: Boss

customer_reviews.title: SIZE CHART IS INCORRECT
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these shoes as a gift for my partner. I clicked on the size chart and ordered what the European size was for a USA 10. I got the shoes & the shoes were a 10 1/2. I am very unhappy with the wrong size chart because my bf thought they were fine and I threw out the receipt once he went climbing he learned these shoes are supposed to be very snug. Will b contacting the customer service. They need to fix the size chart. Shoes are great though good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Since my purchase, I have yet to use these climbing shoes, but from what I can tell. These will work great. The leather is great and the shoes are flexible but sturdy at the same time and fit great on my feet
customer_reviews.author: Ed G

customer_reviews.title: Right for climbing
customer_reviews.text: It a little snug. Walking around the house to break them in before the climb. But just what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Lenore

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, Durable Bouldering Gym shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is great climbing shoe if you frequent the climbing gym. It’s a durable, affordable shoe that will hold up against the wear and tear of the gym. I would definitely recommend this shoe to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Bahama

customer_reviews.title: Sending me a shoes which totally been used for a while!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really bad experience, I order this shoes as a new year gift, here is what it happened, the first time I order, I have a really tight shoes, which I can understand, and everyone said there have some size issue, then I return it and reordered it, after I got it, the shoes is absolutely been used for a while, really bad condition, and because it arrive at 12.31, and I don’t even have more time to get a new gift, thank you for distory my holiday
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value, best shoe in the price range
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is an awesome climbing shoe though it isn't doesn't have the best grip but if your new to climbing and want a solid shoe to start with without breaking the bank, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan J Drake

customer_reviews.title: Best climbing shoes
customer_reviews.text: Best climbing shoes. Fit as expected. Best shoes for the money out there
customer_reviews.author: LaShelle

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner
customer_reviews.text: Great beginning climbing shoe for a cheap price. Can’t say it lasted long once I started hitting 11s but whatever
customer_reviews.author: Sam Sonnabend

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, replace the laces
customer_reviews.text: The biggest problem was the lace durability. Less than a month use and the laces snapped. I've since replaced them with lock laces and it's made them perfect. I just resent the poor laces it shipped with.
customer_reviews.author: Cormac Smyth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Wide Feet
customer_reviews.text: New to climbing and this is my first pair of shoes (tried several rentals before). Incredibly comfortable the minute you put them on. Shapes very well to the type of foot you have. Excellent for wide feet. Laces make this shoe incredibly adjustable. Very comfortable shoe. Definitely must get 1 to 1.5 size smaller than your regular athletic shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Krug

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! Not very flexible so make sure you get the correct size. I bought a size 45 which ended up being a tad bit too small for me, so I returned it with no problems and got a 46 which fits perfectly! The toes have very good reinforcement and grip when climbing.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Heel cup is deep
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great climbing shoe for the price. I don’t know if any particular shoe is going to change your climbing game that much. I had the size 11 and they were too tight, even after a year of wear. The 11 1/2 are a little too big in the heel. I suspect they will fit better after some usage. That is my only complaint, other than that. Great show
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great shoe for when I was leaning to climb. I bought it way bigger than I buy climbing shoes now, so I can't compare what I have to properly fitted shoes, but I loved these as comfortable climbing shoes when I was starting out.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Runs Big
customer_reviews.text: Very good climbing shoe! It's in good condition and my husband likes them, they just run big. He usually wears a regular shoe of 9.5-10 so naturally we got a size 9 shoe. Too big! We returned it and ordered a size 7.5 instead and that did the trick😉
customer_reviews.author: Sariah Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Already coming apart
customer_reviews.text: I thought these shoes would be a lot better. They are already starting to come unglued with mild use- about once a week for a couple months. I will be going for Black Diamonds next, #dissapointed
customer_reviews.author: Tyler E.

customer_reviews.title: Love these babies
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these babies. I got them after finding a girlfriend who was super into climbing and we went almost every single day 5-6 days a week for 4-5 hours at a time. They have lasted a long life and are still in great condition. They fit snug but that was expected. Overall great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great climbing shoes
customer_reviews.text: Only issue is I ordered blue and got orange. But otherwise I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Victor_g

customer_reviews.title: Solid beginner shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great for a beginner. They’re extremely comfortable and break in very well. I’m not sure if I just got a bad shoe, but two of the lace holes starting to rip apart only after a months worth of use. Where as the left is totally fine. I will most likely have to get a new pair as the lace holes arent going to last much longer. Still a good, I might go with Velcro next time.
customer_reviews.author: zachariah zemolong

customer_reviews.title: These  are baby bear's porridge
customer_reviews.text: If you want a snug fit but not an overly sporty tight fit I would order one size down from your street shoe size. The lacing helps get a great fit that I don't get with my Velcro version of this shoe. They are new I'll try to update how the crag has hit them. My velcro version which use the same rubber rand have been through a summer of 3-4 uses a week on granite and gym use and show very little wear.
customer_reviews.author: biding_my_time

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, pay attention to the size chart
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, I can't wait to break them in. Hopefully they'll develop more grip as I wear them. I love the lace design which I have always trusted over velcro but that is just a personal choice.
customer_reviews.author: Guillaume Gentil

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good shoes, but don't "downsize", buy the same size you always buy.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: The fit was great and he said they work well
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son. The fit was great and he said they work well.
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: Just what I expected
customer_reviews.text: They didn’t have my size, so I ordered a half size smaller — sometimes a half size fits on my foot... I got the shoes and they fit perfectly! Also, they’re a LOT more comfortable than the shoes the gym folk regularly rent out.
customer_reviews.author: eduard gudakov

customer_reviews.title: If you have wide feet it might hurt a bit
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for a week now and I say it's a really good starter bouldering shoe. I've used the ones provided at the Vital gym I attend and these feel a lot better. Pros: great grip- fitted to feet - easy to use- very lightweight and Cons: they don't come in wide type feet That's all I really have to say.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I got this shoe as my first pair when I began bouldering and they were fantastic. They were great when I was climbing V1s and great when I was climbing V6s.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Wright

customer_reviews.title: La Sportiva Tarantulace Shoe - Men's Climbing shoes 45.5 Kiwi
customer_reviews.text: These are only my second pair of climbing shoes and they are excellent! I normally wear an 11 and I am not a professional climber and am still learning but they fit just snug so the fit is comparable to your shoe size unless you like them tighter then go maybe half a size down, would recommend them to everyone who climbs.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: terrible sizing
customer_reviews.text: came in and weren't anywhere close to the size ordered
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Owens

customer_reviews.title: - He liked the feel and look of them
customer_reviews.text: Sending it back to get a smaller size as not true to sizing. He wears a 10-10.5 and he could place two fingers behind his heel inside the shoe. Getting another pair a size down so hopefully these will work,- He liked the feel and look of them.
customer_reviews.author: ltb

customer_reviews.title: These shoes seem to be a great starter shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes seem to be a great starter shoe. Not too aggressive, pretty comfortable, and not too expensive. They ended up being just slightly looser than I thought they would be, I'd recomend ordering a 1/2 size down on the EU size chart.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Ellison

customer_reviews.title: ... am a ladies size 10 and my feet are pretty wide. These have been GREAT for my climbing
customer_reviews.text: I am a ladies size 10 and my feet are pretty wide. These have been GREAT for my climbing.
customer_reviews.author: C. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: I'm a size 10 on the streets. I would ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a size 10 on the streets. I would suggest you get a size 9 or smaller. Takes about 3 or 4 times to break in properly
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: eyelet ripped shortly after purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Fit was great and has plenty of grip, particularly for crag climbing, but on of the little eyelets that holds the lace ripped after less than a month of use. still usable but i expect better for the price.
customer_reviews.author: C.Wil

customer_reviews.title: La Sportiva shoe size chart is wrong
customer_reviews.text: Just received my climbing shoes and am very disappointed, the shoe chart says US 9.5 would be 43 in La Sportiva, unfortunately when I got the shoes it says 43 but US 10 and they are too big. Thought I was going to go climbing with my new shoes, not gonna happen.
customer_reviews.author: priscilla

customer_reviews.title: Order a bit smaller than you think you need
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear size 10.5 shoes, started with the 44 M EU but they were looser than I'd like in a climbing shoe so I swapped for the 43.5, broke in within the first day, been happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Happy husband
customer_reviews.text: Husband says that they fit well and "comfortable" (as comfortable it can be a climbing shoe). His feet fir perfectly in the shoe without giving any extra space or being tight.
customer_reviews.author: Ihara Dutra

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: It's always a little tough to get right sizing online but I went with what was my shoe size and they fit fine. I maybe would have liked to have gone a half size small since they are leather but nothing a little tight lacing doesn't fix. Love the feel and grip on these shoe and can comfortably wear them all day in the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, great brand and a great fit! I do recommend getting a hslf size bigger!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: ... when i go rock climbing and these shoes feel great on my feet
customer_reviews.text: Personally I don't wear socks when i go rock climbing and these shoes feel great on my feet. They perform well, and the size chart is very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Wing

customer_reviews.title: (Most climbers like there shoes a size smaller) I really like la ...
customer_reviews.text: "Fits as Expected" only because I've been climbing for 15 years. (Most climbers like there shoes a size smaller) I really like la sportiva shoes. I had the Mythos for a few years with no problems so I decided try these. So far so good. The material is a leather so it will stretch a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Great Allrounder
customer_reviews.text: Runs 1/2 US size smaller for tight fit. With normal size all my toes were painfully rolled back . Used free exchange to larger size. Climbing it for true mountain rock walls difficulty 5+ to 6b.
customer_reviews.author: Li Sa Yung

customer_reviews.title: True to size!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit, I got the size 13 (US) and and I had as much room as my size 13 Adidas. But the same size as your regular shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Shoes are a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: May have gotten lucky with the size. Picked 44 M EU. I wear mens US size 10.5 shoes. Shoes are a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my college student taking rock climbing for a PE class. He says these shoes are way more comfortable than he thought they’d be. Very pleased he has them!
customer_reviews.author: Erin M. McAlpin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit and grip. For the money these are great
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Initially felt a little small, but then stretched to ...
customer_reviews.text: Initially felt a little small, but then stretched to the point that they feel slightly large now. Stretch is expected from an unlined shoe such as this, and the experienced stretch was completely within the expected range.
customer_reviews.author: Arkaeas

customer_reviews.title: So it is a good idea to order several sizes and use free return ...
customer_reviews.text: Whenever I go to climbing gym I have to rent shoes 1/2 size smaller than my shoe size. With these I had to stop at 1/2 size bigger than my regular shoe size, even considering that it is going to stretch as I climb more. So it is a good idea to order several sizes and use free return option to send the ones that are too small/ too big.
customer_reviews.author: natchee

customer_reviews.title: Good Climbing Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my son, so going by what he has to say. He said that he liked them very much, they work well for climbing, and they fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great climbing shoes
customer_reviews.text: Tight fitting but they are designed that way. Works well on the rock wall and two other climbers that I climb with have the same pair. Great price and quality. They run tight as they should.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Pecina

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate to European sizing.  I wear a 42 and it fits like a glove.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first climbing shoe and is everything I expected and more. I couldn’t have found a better fitting climbing shoe. As a beginner this shoe has boosted my performance over the gym rentals. Totally happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: I bought half size smaller and they fit perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Very good shoe. Fits perfect. Hit a 5 11 with them. Smudges great, no sore toes. Of course mine are beat up.
customer_reviews.author: lewis reardon

customer_reviews.title: Just a bit loose..
customer_reviews.text: These are good shoes, don't get me wrong. However, they run slightly loose. I rented shoes in the same size for months, and they were tighter than these. Good for wide feet, which I have, however the toe box is just a bit roomy.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Albritton

customer_reviews.title: I went down a 1/2 size for good fit.
customer_reviews.text: Good fit. I normally where a 9 1/2 and bought this in a 9. Snug fit but not uncomfortable after 2 hours in the bouldering gym.
customer_reviews.author: Miggedy

customer_reviews.title: Green Socks and Great climbs
customer_reviews.text: Very cute and comfortable. Only bad part is that they will dye your socks green
customer_reviews.author: Boxaholic #shipmystuff

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. I chose half a size smaller than my regular shoe size and as to be expected they are tight but not uncomfortable. I have good grip and control when climbing.
customer_reviews.author: Birger

customer_reviews.title: so hard to find clibing shoes for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: First pair of hiking shoes to fit. I am normally 8D in men(s) or 9W(W) in womens.
customer_reviews.author: Shanice Raschilla

customer_reviews.title: better find original La Sportiva size chat
customer_reviews.text: Be careful with the size, better find original La Sportiva size chat. And there is no men or women this shoe, just check original size chat.
customer_reviews.author: Andrey Khaisin

customer_reviews.title: great climbing shoes
customer_reviews.text: great climbing shoes, but mine came a little dirty or used a bit, not a big deal. but when you pay the price in full you expect to get a new shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Meshal Alkinani

customer_reviews.title: These worked much better for me
customer_reviews.text: Originally tried Mad Rock beginner climbing shoes, but with my arches and toes (toes are in a straight line as opposed to going from bigger to smaller) they were uncomfortable. These worked much better for me. Very comfortable, I can climb much more comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner/intermediate shoe
customer_reviews.text: Had these for about 5 months or so, heavy use indoors and light use outdoors and they’ve held up great. I went true to size but I recommend going a half or whole size down
customer_reviews.author: Davis

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Price is right. Feels slippery, more slippery than my ten year old pair. Could be in my head.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Brown

customer_reviews.title: Reliable starter shoe
customer_reviews.text: Nice and comfortable! Tight but do not hurt. As a newbie, I am glad at their quality for the price
customer_reviews.author: Klinkhammer

customer_reviews.title: comfortable for climbing shoes
customer_reviews.text: I wear these 2x a week, functions and comfortable as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very quality, standard shoe for beginners like me.
customer_reviews.text: I was tempted to say its somewhat small/tight, but that's how climbing shoes are supposed to fit.
customer_reviews.author: dibbs

customer_reviews.title: Great company and product
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoes! Had a friend buy them as well. These are an awesome fit and a great product. Good company to clientele care that I was very pleased with.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Great climbing shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great climbing shoes. They're snug, but they're supposed to be. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: For the price I am happy with it
customer_reviews.text: For the price I am happy with it. If it has more lace towards the front would be better.
customer_reviews.author: kokoka

customer_reviews.title: Completely Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Not even sure where to start, this show was such a let down on every practical level. Sure, it LOOKS good, but that's it. If you have average feel like I do, you'll look like one of Cinderella's evil step sisters trying to squeeze into the glass slipper. No way anyone can fit into these unless they can describe their foot as "dainty". Length on them is completely fine, but the width is insanely narrow. The second, glaring, and unfortunate problem with these is the sole. Basically, the sole is hard and slick- think old crusty leather, and you are close. I'm dumbfounded that these are marketed as climbing shoes, honestly.
customer_reviews.author: Ghmerrill

customer_reviews.title: but one size down i just the good balance between fit and confort
customer_reviews.text: 42eu, took a 41. Fit perfectly for a full training, if i wanted something harder, i would go one size lower, but one size down i just the good balance between fit and confort. Great shoes overall
customer_reviews.author: ANTHOINE Andy

product_meta.title: La Sportiva Men's TarantuLace Performance Rock Climbing Shoe
product_meta.description: The La Sportiva TarantuLace is the super-comfortable, high-performance solution for any climber looking for one shoe to do it all. Designed for intermediate climbers, the TarantuLace features a rugged rubber heel rand, grippy FriXion RS rubber soles, and a low- asymmetry RN45 shoe shape, lending plenty of grip, support, and sensitivity. Refusing to sacrifice comfort for technical performance, the synthetic leather overlay lacing harness adds great support for beginner to mid level climbers, and the unlined leather upper and breathable lined tongue are comfy and soft. Whether hitting your local gym wall or an expert-level pitch, this men's one-quiver climbing shoe will keep you moving up.
feature_bullets: FAST LACING SYSTEM - Quick-pull lacing harness allows for precise regulation of inner volumes; Wrapping the foot snugly for excellent support, fit, and comfort

ALL-AROUND PERFORMANCE - Designed to help intermediate climbers smear, hook, and edge like pros; The aggressive rubber heel rand, sticky FriXion RS rubber soles, and low-asymmetry RN45 build let climbers find purchase on edges with great sensitivity and without pain or cramping

CLIMB IN COMFORT - From the gym to the crags, the classic unlined leather upper is soft and comfortable; Lined tongue controls moisture and enhances breathability; Synthetic leather overlay adds just the right level of support

BUILT TO LAST - This indoor/outdoor climbing shoe is constructed from high quality materials; 1.8mm LaspoFlex at the midsole and 5mm FriXion RS at the sole make the TarantuLace as stable as it is durable

TIPS FOR BUYING - Rock climbing shoes are designed to fit differently than other footwear; Be sure to reference the La Sportiva size chart in the product images for more accurate sizing; The fit should be tight, but not painful, and without pressure points
